intro: Arenaria uintahensis, commonly known as Uinta sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
